results.title: Gary Regan, Maestro of Mixology and Cocktail Culture, Dies at 68
results.abstract: A British-born son of publicans, he became a bartender in New York, a saloonkeeper, an author of 18 books and a columnist and commentator.

multimedia.caption: The mixologist Gary Regan in 2012. He led an exuberant life as a bartender, saloonkeeper, columnist and author. He reportedly wore eyeliner as a reminder to bartenders to look the customer in the eye.
multimedia.copyright: Ian Gavan/Getty Images

results.title: André Daguin Dies at 84; Chef Made Gascony (and a Dish) Famous
results.abstract: His menu, most notably the grilled duck breast, made a region of southwest France a required stop for traveling food lovers.

multimedia.caption: André Daguin in 1993 in the kitchen of his family’s hotel, the Hôtel de France in Auch, in southwest France. His restaurant earned a Michelin star in 1960 and a second star 10 years later, making Auch a required stop for traveling food lovers.
multimedia.copyright: Benoit Gysembergh/Paris Match, via Getty Images
